name: Dr. Jendayi Elizabeth Frazer
title: Chancellor, Riara University
bio: Dr. Jendayi Elizabeth Frazer, the 2nd Chancellor of Riara University, is a distinguished diplomat, accomplished academic, celebrated educationist, visionary entrepreneur, and renowned Africanist. Her appointment marks a historic chapter for the university, as she becomes the first woman to hold this esteemed position. Dr. Frazer is the President and CEO of 50 Ventures, a private consulting and investment firm committed to elevating Africa's global standing through strategic investments in governance, education, enterprise, and stability sectors. She is also a Duignan Distinguished Visiting Fellow at the Hoover Institution, Stanford University. From 2009 to 2014, she served as a Distinguished Public Service Professor at Carnegie Mellon University's Heinz College, where she also directed the Center for International Policy and Innovation (CIPI). Her research and leadership focused on advancing regional security, political and economic integration in Africa, and applying innovative technologies to development challenges. Dr. Frazer has held several high-ranking roles in the U.S. government, including U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs (2005–2009), U.S. Ambassador to South Africa — the first woman to hold this role (August 3, 2004 to August 26, 2005), and Special Assistant to the President and Senior Director for African Affairs at the National Security Council (2001–2004). Her achievements have earned her multiple accolades, including the U.S. Secretary of State's Distinguished Service Medal (the highest civilian award by the Secretary of State); the Dame Grand Commander in the Humane Order of African Redemption from Liberia's President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf; and the Distinguished Leadership Award from Boston University's African Presidential Archives and Research Center. An alumna of Stanford University, Dr. Frazer holds a BA in Political Science and African and Afro-American Studies, dual MAs in International Policy Studies and International Development Education, and a PhD in Political Science, all from Stanford University. She also earned an MBA from the American University. With vast experience spanning diplomacy, academia, policy, and investment, Dr. Frazer continues to champion initiatives that drive Africa's transformation. Her enduring commitment to higher education is exemplified by her significant contributions in the establishment of the Carnegie Mellon University in Kigali, Rwanda, and her longstanding relationship with Riara University, having served as the Keynote Speaker during our 2nd Commencement Ceremony in 2018. Dr. Frazer's visionary leadership and unwavering passion for Africa, education, and innovation, position her as a guiding force in shaping Riara University's future.

name: Prof. Gateru
title: Vice Chancellor
bio: Professor Gateru brings extensive experience in higher education leadership and academic excellence. With a distinguished career spanning over three decades, he has been instrumental in shaping Riara University's vision of nurturing innovators.

name: Prof. Wanja Tenambergen
title: Deputy Vice Chancellor - Academic Affairs
bio: Professor Wanja Tenambergen oversees all academic programs and ensures the highest standards of teaching and learning across the university. With over 25 years of experience in academia, she has been pivotal in curriculum development and quality assurance initiatives.

name: Dr. Peter Ochieng
title: Registrar
bio: Dr. Ochieng manages the university's administrative functions, student records, and academic services. He ensures efficient operations of the registrar's office and maintains the integrity of academic records and student data.

name: Dr. Lando Welcome
title: Dean, Riara Law School
bio: Excellence in legal education and commitment to shaping the next generation of legal professionals. Dr. Welcome has extensive experience in legal practice and academia, with a focus on constitutional law and human rights.

name: Dr. Opati Welcome
title: Dean, School of Business
bio: Empowering students to become innovative leaders and entrepreneurs who drive positive change in the business world. Dr. Welcome brings decades of industry experience and academic excellence to business education.

name: Prof. Musau Welcome
title: Dean, School of Computing Sciences
bio: Leading innovation in technology education and preparing students for careers in the digital economy. Prof. Musau Welcome is a renowned expert in computer science with research interests in artificial intelligence and software engineering.

name: Prof. Grace Njeri
title: Dean, School of Education
bio: Dedicated to preparing exceptional educators who transform learning environments. Professor Njeri has extensive experience in teacher education and curriculum development, with a passion for educational innovation.

name: Joy Mueni
title: Dean, School of International Relations & Diplomacy
bio: Expert in international relations and diplomatic studies, preparing students for careers in global affairs. Joy Mueni brings extensive diplomatic experience and academic expertise to international relations education.

name: Joy Mueni
title: Dean, School of Communication and Multimedia Journalism
department: School of Communication and Multimedia Journalism
bio: Leading the next generation of media professionals and communicators. Joy Mueni has extensive experience in journalism and media studies, with a focus on digital media and multimedia storytelling.

name: Mr. David Kimani
title: Director of Finance
bio: Overseeing the university's financial operations and ensuring sustainable growth. Mr. Kimani brings extensive experience in financial management and strategic planning, ensuring the university's fiscal health and sustainability.

name: Ms. Grace Muthoni
title: Director of Student Affairs
bio: Supporting student success through comprehensive services, programs, and resources. Ms. Muthoni is dedicated to creating a vibrant campus community that supports student growth, development, and well-being.

name: Dr. John Kipchoge
title: Director of Academic Planning
bio: Leading strategic academic planning and curriculum development initiatives across all schools. Dr. Kipchoge ensures alignment between academic programs and industry needs while maintaining high educational standards.

name: Dr. Patricia Wambui
title: Director of Research & Innovation
bio: Championing research excellence and innovation across all disciplines. Dr. Wambui facilitates research partnerships, manages research grants, and supports faculty and student research initiatives that address real-world challenges.

name: Ms. Susan Chebet
title: Director of Admissions
bio: Leading the university's admissions process and student recruitment efforts. Ms. Chebet ensures a fair and transparent admissions process while attracting talented students from diverse backgrounds.

name: Mr. Brian Mutua
title: Director of Information Technology
bio: Overseeing the university's IT infrastructure and digital transformation initiatives. Mr. Mutua ensures reliable technology services that support teaching, learning, research, and administrative operations.

name: Dr. Elizabeth Nyambura
title: Director of Library Services
bio: Leading the university library's mission to provide comprehensive information resources and services. Dr. Nyambura oversees digital and physical collections, research support, and information literacy programs.

name: Ms. Jane Wanjala
title: Director of Marketing & Communications
bio: Shaping the university's brand and communicating its mission to diverse audiences. Ms. Wanjala leads marketing strategies, public relations, and communications initiatives that enhance the university's reputation and visibility.
